ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Introduction to the topic of reconstructing religion based on material remains, including in conjunction with other data such as texts and images. I would definitely recommend it. The course brought together a number of issues that are touched upon by several disciplines, and is thus importantly interdisciplinary.

This course allows students to consider the possible types of evidence archaeologists may use to identify religious activities, including rituals, sacred spaces, pilgrimage sites, and types of shamanic activities. I would highly recommend this course to other students, especially those interested in the interpretations behind religious materiality.
I would recommend any archaeology student to take this course because the subject matter is too often overlooked and it's incredibly valuable.

This is an excellent course for students who are interested in archaeology and religion. I would recommend to other students because it really help one better understand archaeology of religion in a global perspective.
I would definitely reccomend this course to another student. It is an in-depth, yet easily comprehensible study of the archaeological study of religion.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It contributed considerably to my dissertation and research as it broached the very topic of my dissertation several times.

This course allowed me to consider the insight that religious iconography can provide behind religious traditions (thematic approaches i.e. Donnan). Furthermore, the final assignment allowed me to reflect on the material and architectural criteria typically associated with religious pilgrimages, realizing that many of these huge religious movements to have certain criteria that are typically followed cross-culturally.
This course help me understand the different phenomena of ritual in archaeological context. I was able to think the archaeological material in a different perspective.
